Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery slight ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with light-brown slip, two parallel lines of cord-marked decoration and faint traces of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394902) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394902)
